website_summaries.verdict: A powerful cordless hedge trimmer with a 24-inch dual action blade.
pros: Uses a G-MAX 2 ampere hour 40V Li-ion battery
Battery compatible with other Greenworks tools
180-degree rotating rear handle makes it comfortable to trim at different angles
cons: Cutting action starts to have difficulty with branches about 1 inch thick
Lower strokes per minute produces rough cut on bushes

customer_reviews.title: Excellent - highly recommended for serious yard work
customer_reviews.text: This trimmer is great, a real workhorse. Lightweight and very easy to handle, yet cuts through brush up to 1/2" diameter easily. I've used it multiple times almost non-stop for 2 hrs with the 4 Ah battery, and it still had a charge left every time. i've included before and after photos of extensive clearing of stubborn thorny weeds/brush — it made quick work of it. At the end of the first use it was making some straining/whining noises, so I sprayed it with silicone-formula WD-40 up and down the blades while it was running, and that completely solved the problem. Now I spray it after every extended use.
customer_reviews.author: Rider

customer_reviews.title: So Far so Good
customer_reviews.text: We have a few of the GreenWorks units and they seem to hold up under normal household use. This unit is much better than an electrical one and the battery lasts for a full day's work, light to moderate trimming. It is as heavy as the old electrical cord unit but infinitely less cumbersome. The cutting is adequate and no jamming. However we do not attempt to cut any thick stems such as hollies. It is used on taxus and the like and only for excess seasonal growth. We have a trimmer which also works well and can use the same battery. Overall this seems to work quite well and seems reasonably sturdy.
customer_reviews.author: Dr. Terrence McGartyTop Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: Exceeded Expectations
customer_reviews.text: I have been hard on Greenworks - with cause - for their mowers and blowers. And while I would pay for something else if I received either of those for free, their smaller yard tools are really good bang for the buck. I have this hedgetrimmer and a blower which operate with the same batteries. For the price, they perform great. This trimmer's rotating handle is comfortable, easy to use, the blades are sharp, and the 2.0 Ah battery lasted long enough to trim a tree and 25 feet of hedges as well as rip through some nuisance shrubs with >1" stalks that keep coming back along my garage. Hard to have anything bad to say about their smaller tools.
customer_reviews.author: Resume Ryan

customer_reviews.title: Its a great little tool
customer_reviews.text: I love the fact that Greenworks make tools that can all use the same battery. I've had their lawnmower for a few years, which has been fantastically reliable, so I bought the tool without a battery and saved money (Yeah!). The battery makes it a bit heavy for me but my fit, young, single sons say it's light so take that as opinion rather than fact. I love being able to twist the direction of the 'blade' which makes it very responsive especially on a tricky little hedge I have that came with the house, and which I hate to the toenails of my soul. Reliable, good size, powerful enough for home garden maintenence and flexible.
customer_reviews.author: Lobster

customer_reviews.title: Best Gift For My Husband
customer_reviews.text: I have my own set of tools and my husband kept borrowing them and breaking them or not returning them. This I bought for him and since owning it he's done his own trimming of the hedges, shrubs, and small tree clean up. He charges the battery so it's always ready for his next use and he takes very good care of this. I've personally never used it, but since buying it for him, I've never had to do any more outdoor chores. He loves this, and I love him for using it. (I'm just wondering why it took me 18 years of marriage to figure out that all he needed was his own set of tools. ROFL.)
customer_reviews.author: Angela Brown

customer_reviews.title: Less than 2 months until premature death
customer_reviews.text: After less than 2 months of use the trimmer died yesterday while cutting back some light spring growth. All of a sudden it started clicking and the blade stopped. Thought something was caught in the blade. Careful inspection revealed a single leaf. Cutting blade would not start again. This was on a fresh charge. Looks like I will be going back to my Black and Decker corded hedge trimmer. Delivered on April 25. Died April 15th at 10;30 AM
customer_reviews.author: Jimbo 47

customer_reviews.title: Made the job easy
customer_reviews.text: Works great, chops through tough shrubs like butter. Upgraded from greenworks 20 volt trimmer znd the difference is day and night. So glad i bought this. Makes a hard job lots easier. By the way, i am a 77 year old woman and this is easy to hold and work with.
customer_reviews.author: diane  lowrance

customer_reviews.title: An excellent product...
customer_reviews.text: I first purchased a Greenworks chain saw for cutting up fallen branches and firewood and had excellent results. Given that I purchased the hedge trimmer with the hopes of the same results and satisfaction and I was not disappointed. Being able to sheer my hedges and bushes without dragging an electrical was such a joy. The unit does an amazing job of cutting. The blades adjusts left or right to make cutting easier. I was surprised how powerful it actually is. I was so impressed with my two Greenworks power tools I purchased a weedwacker which also works awesome. I definitely recommend...
customer_reviews.author: Raymo

customer_reviews.title: Right out of the box, while charging the battery ...
customer_reviews.text: Right out of the box, while charging the battery, the charger basically blew up. It made a loud pop and smoke starting coming out of it. I unplugged the unit and called Greenworks. They sent me a replacement unit right away and I've had no problems since.
customer_reviews.author: Bill

customer_reviews.title: Serious vibration in handle made hands numb and arms painful after 45 minutes, pain lasted for days
customer_reviews.text: This is advertised as lightweight and maneuverable but it actually is not. The side handle and flip mechanism for the blade is awkward and not a natural position to the hands. The battery life is ok having reached the 45 minute mark with light pruning. But pruning on 1/4"+ branches causes the pruner to catch, jerk and slow down and caused trauma to my hands and lower arms that were painful and buzzing for days afterward. This pruner does not do well with branches thicker than 1/4" which cause extra vibration. You might want to look elsewhere to save your hands / arms.
customer_reviews.author: mosslake

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Product
customer_reviews.text: I did a lot of internet research on what trimmer to buy and many I looked at sold the battery and charger separately whereas this one came with the battery and charger included. One other feature that I really like about this unit is that you can rotate the head 90 degrees either left or right which allows you to trim while not having to hold the trimmer at that 90 degree angle. Price and features sold me on the unit and I used it 2 days ago for the first time and it sliced right thru any limb it touched. Very nice and worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: William Hull

customer_reviews.title: The cheapest yet best of the bunch! Highly recommended!
customer_reviews.text: I’ve tested comparable voltage hedge trimmers from several brands, notably Milwaukee, DeWalt, and Ego. That said, while this was the cheapest of the bunch by a longshot this trimmer is a joy to use and is easily recommended above it’s competitors. Very light weight, eats up very little battery on my 4ah, and most impressively has the rotating handle which is a game changing feature. We have dense boxwoods and, unlike what others have purported, this has effortlessly cut through them without issue. Highly recommended- the strong reviews are warranted!
customer_reviews.author: Life Generalist

customer_reviews.title: Love this companies products but.
customer_reviews.text: First day using. I was trimming and cutters were jammed do to plant or dirt or something. While working to get it to release. Smoke poured out of the trimmer. It's now in the trash. I've had an battery black and decker for 10 years. And it's still cutting and not jamming. This is one trimmer, that does not seem to hold up. Would recommend considering another brand. Just on this only. I have two of the battery weed wackers and two blowers. They kick butt. No problems 2 years.
customer_reviews.author: Scott

customer_reviews.title: I'm in love with Greenworks
customer_reviews.text: First I bought the trimmer and was so happy with it, I bought the leaf blower, again very happy, next I bought the weed eater. So far I am happy with everything I have purchased and the best part, the batteries are interchangeable. After having tools that use gas, these are a blessing. Light weight, easy to use, and best of all no stinking gas smell.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Loud Noise after 10 Minutes
customer_reviews.text: Worked great for 10 minutes, then loud noise. Tried calling customer service five times...sent three emails...NO response. Ordered replacement. Will see if it works better.
customer_reviews.author: Michael W. Williams

customer_reviews.title: Dead after 4 months of mild use
customer_reviews.text: Only use this once every couple of weeks to trim our backyard. Can probably count on both hands how many times it was used. Went to trim today, not working. Swapped batteries, same thing, Sounds like it's trying to move, removed the blades, same thing. So it has to be something in the motor itself. Completely disappointed with this product.
customer_reviews.author: Paul

customer_reviews.title: Impressive Great Value cuts very well, lasts long, great time saver.
customer_reviews.text: I got the battery less one as I have a Greenworks 40v mower. Insane deal if you have the battery already. This thing is incredibly powerful. It cuts everything up to 3/4 inch i have thrown at it. Tree branches and Bushes. Literally cuts like a knife through butter. I can't make the battery go down at all. Only had a manual shear before. You are much more efficient with a power tool. So easy to trim things I am randomly looking for things to cut to make things look better around the house.
customer_reviews.author: JG

customer_reviews.title: Powerful trimmer
customer_reviews.text: This trimmer works really well on bushes and has enough power to get through branches that were an inch or mere thick in diameter. The safety features, including the debris guard and the button+trigger turn-on, provide some reassurance for the skittish. It's also a quite lightweight tool--I did not strain while using it. It works with the same 40 amp batteries that power the other Greenworks tools.
customer_reviews.author: Houston

customer_reviews.title: Seems to work well
customer_reviews.text: I own 5 pieces of the 40v greensworks tools. Some I have two sets !!! One for house and one for the lake. Needed to trim up some Golden Euonymus bushes - some of the bushes have branches thicker than a 1st grade pencil..... this cut them no problem. Time will tell - but for the 20 minutes I used them - it worked very well and I still had 3 out of 4 green lights on the battery. The rotating handle is a neat addition too.
customer_reviews.author: T-Bone85

customer_reviews.title: The battery design is not as good as other brands
customer_reviews.text: The trimmer is a good product. It's the battery that makes me wish I would have bought a different brand. The battery release clip is designed for dainty little hands. The release is especially hard to release after a few months of use. It is also hard to release after you've been working hard in the yard and your hands are sweaty. You almost need to go ask your wife, "Honey, can you release the battery from the trimmer, please?"
customer_reviews.author: Gregg Fairchild

customer_reviews.title: some of which were a good 8 feet high
customer_reviews.text: A previous owner went nuts planting butterfly bushes on my lot and never trimmed them. I had to cut back about 20 of them, some of which were a good 8 feet high. My smaller corded trimmer was no match, and the cord was a pain, so I decided to splurge on battery powered trimmer, but was shocked at the price of most. This item had great reviews and a great price, so I went for it and am VERY happy. This did a much better job than my other trimmer as it can cut much bigger branches and has great reach. It's not too heavy either, although holding it above my head did give me a good work out.
customer_reviews.author: Katherine

customer_reviews.title: Another Excellent Greenworks Product
customer_reviews.text: Good quality as usual, doesn’t cut through hedges as well as expected considering its 40 volt. I don’t think this is an issue when compared to other makes, however more of an old design re the cutting blades, time someone came up with a better design . Struggles when trying to cut through thicker stalk hedges especially if you swipe slowly. Certainly Greenworks. Make great cordless products as we have the mower, the striker which is brilliant and the blower which is also brilliant, please make an edger 😳
customer_reviews.author: Phdinnis

customer_reviews.title: Not great for thicker hedges
customer_reviews.text: This is a decent unit for cutting light bushes, hedges. But once the branches get thicker than 1/2" this will completely stick. Never had this issue even with a lightweight gas powered unit. I'm keeping it because the wife is pretty happy with it to trim the smaller bushes in our yard, but I'll stick with a gas unit for the larger stuff.
customer_reviews.author: Rick

customer_reviews.title: Greenworks 24-Inch 40V Cordless Hedge Trimmer
customer_reviews.text: Works great! We have the pole chainsaw with battery and charger from the same company so this unit is able to share charged batteries. Their products are durable and well made. We live in NH in maple tree country where maple saplings grow every spring. They are invasive, so I am using the trimmer to cut away the saplings at the root so they don't take over a field. I am 5'2" and this unit is light enough for me to handle, plus there isn't the risk of cutting a chord like an electric unit.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas Dalbec

customer_reviews.title: Works well Delivered April 20
customer_reviews.text: No changes - One has to buy all the tools from the same company due to battery costs. The company does honor the warranty with a smile. The "catch" on top of the battery would not release. Sent a new one at once. Lawnmower, trimmer, and blower use the same battery. 3 yeas old. The wife and I use the blower every day. We really like it. Trimmer works better than my corded one and I can not cut the cord.
customer_reviews.author: bertg

customer_reviews.title: Good trimmer, but on the heavy side
customer_reviews.text: It's very good at trimming shrubs and smaller branches. However, it is heavier, with the battery attached, than I thought it would be. For a petite woman, it's a workout to hold these for any length of time. Better for the environment than gas-powered. One good thing, you get your weight-training in. Good product, but not lightweight for a petite older person. Maybe I should have ordered the shorter length model.
customer_reviews.author: Marilyn11

customer_reviews.title: I love this thing
customer_reviews.text: All the Greenworks products (trimmer, blower, weedwhacker) I purchased this summer were fantastic. Lightweight and a pleasure to us. I Recommend them. I have 3 batteries, so when blowing the huge amount of leaves recently I needed all 3 batteries. When went down I put it on the charger and it was ready by the time I used up the other two. Great, Great products.
customer_reviews.author: Nancy E. Koorey

customer_reviews.title: Great engineering! Balance, flexibility and ease of use are big pluses!
customer_reviews.text: I would highly recommend this product as well as the company, Greenworks. This is my second purchase from Greenworks. I have the battery operated blower and lawn edger. I purchased the original set about 2 or 3 years ago. I have charged the battery when the 4 lights drop down to 1 or 2 lights. I can only hope that the new hedge trimmer battery lasts as long. I really the balance of the trimmer.
customer_reviews.author: Ricky28

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight and much easier to wield than the corded version ...
customer_reviews.text: Lightweight and much easier to wield than the corded version it replaced. Charge lasts long enough to do my whole front yard and then some. Not the most heavyweight cutting power but more than enough for the bushes and hedges in my yard. For anything thicker I'd use a mauler or something heavier. When my blower dies (I can't find a corded one that lasts more than 3-5 years) I'll get a Ryobi blower/vac.
customer_reviews.author: Tippy Toe

customer_reviews.title: Buy it NOW!
customer_reviews.text: Don't hesitate about this and buy it NOW!! I wish I had bought this way sooner. It is so simple to use. I got tired of dragging out the extension cord for our old hedge trimmer and it constantly coming unplugged. And let's not even talk about me cutting the cord and my husband having to repair it. This one simply charges up (in less than an hour) and then it lasted at least an hour if not a little more. And I had it working the whole time. This is definitely worth it!!
customer_reviews.author: Bryan Horton

customer_reviews.title: It cuts good and not too heavy
customer_reviews.text: Works well. I only trim a few bushes at a time because I'm getting a little older now. It cuts good and not too heavy. Battery seems to last for ever and I have a spare because I also have the extend a reach trimmer for tall bushes. No cords to cut. Take it out-cut-put it away-done!
customer_reviews.author: Joan Hafenrichter

customer_reviews.title: Good Trimmer
customer_reviews.text: This is a really nice, powerful, battery powered hedge trimmer. It does a great job on my shrubs and small trees. It is pretty heavy, but is well balanced enough to be able to operate one handed for long reach (and it already has a long blade). Charges quickly and holds charge long enough to take care of everything I need - about 20-30 minutes of steady use. It is holding up well and I love being cordless and gas free.
customer_reviews.author: Ed Barton

customer_reviews.title: Happy Mistake
customer_reviews.text: I bought this because I had actually bought the wrong battery and charger for another Greenworks product. So instead of returning them I saw this hedge trimmer for sale with good reviews. The unit is very good and much better than the old B&D 110v unit. I actually didn't realise how many shrubs I had that could easily be groomed with this unit.
customer_reviews.author: L. A. Curtis

customer_reviews.title: Love Greenworks
customer_reviews.text: I love the Greenworks battery operated equipment. Exchangeable batteries charge quickly and last long enough to get the job done. Was able to beautifully trim 6 hedges with one battery. No exhaust fumes, no gasoline to pour, no electric cords to look after. Easy start. Heavyness is due to battery but very manageable for a 60 yo woman.
customer_reviews.author: Brenda Schmidt

customer_reviews.title: Able to handle a big job
customer_reviews.text: Used this trimmer on a 120' hedge and it had no problem at all. Handles fairly large branches as well as my old gas powered trimmer. About 40 minutes run time on 2 amp battery and 1.5 hrs on 5 amp battery. Definitely easier to use than may old gas trimmer. Very pleased with this purchase. Now I have people wanting to borrow it!
customer_reviews.author: Dr Mike

customer_reviews.title: Love It
customer_reviews.text: Man this made chores so much easier yesterday! I trimmed hedges shrubbery and grapevines. Yes, I said it, grapevines. I used the small Greenworks battery with only two bars worked for two hours and still didn't run out of juice. Very nice! It is ready to go straight from the box so don't worry about setting aside time to put it together. Also, I love the rotating handle. Those Yew bushes got a very nice shave yesterday.
customer_reviews.author: Takia

customer_reviews.title: Excellent for a Battery Powered Trimmer
customer_reviews.text: The trimmer is very maneuverable and light. I cut with it for over 30 minutes before needing to charge the battery. The 40 volt battery provided plenty of power. There were some 1/2 inch branches on the bushes and the trimmer cut them with ease. If you are looking for a battery operated trimmer, this one is a good buy.
customer_reviews.author: Oldster

customer_reviews.title: Great yard tools
customer_reviews.text: I’m really impressed with these Greenworks tools. I have the pole saw, air compressor, blower, chainsaw, string trimmer, and most recently, this hedge trimmer. These are beautifully designed and although they aren’t as powerful as gasoline operated devices, you don’t have fuel the mix or engines to crank. Although I have an extra battery, one battery charge usually lasts long enough to do the job I want. A major advantage is the fact that they are so light that you don’t wear yourself out holding a heavy device.
customer_reviews.author: James H. Green

customer_reviews.title: GREAT Hedge Trimmer!!!
customer_reviews.text: I have the lawn mower, chainsaw and weed wacker so did not need to buy a battery. As with the others, LOVE this hedge trimmer, Greenworks 24-Inch 40V Cordless Hedge Trimmer with Rotating Handle, Battery Not Included. It's lightweight and no foolish cord to cut through!!!! YIPPEE! Free to wander the yard and get it done. Highly recommend Greenwork products.
customer_reviews.author: D.C.M.

customer_reviews.title: Superb for smaller yards!
customer_reviews.text: Love this thing! I have s small house/yard with just one 4x12 hedge to keep neat - and of course I have to keep cutting back my neighbor’s ‘hedge’ (ie random bush) too. This is quick and easy to use and works like a charm. This uses the 40v battery and it dies fine. I can trim the hedge, now the yard, weed whack, and edge the flower bed on one charge. If you have a small yard and just don’t want to manually clip this is for you!
customer_reviews.author: Mare Glenn

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Hedge Trimmer
customer_reviews.text: This trimmer works better than the corded one I had before. Very clean cuts and the adjustable head makes trimming so much easier. I have cut 3/4 inch thick branches easily with this. The balance is good, it is still slightly heavy, but not so much that it is unusable. Compared to a gas trimmer it is light. The battery life is very good, I can finish my entire yard on one 2.5Ah battery. Very happy with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Walter B. Miller

customer_reviews.title: Wow, these tools are excellent
customer_reviews.text: Awesome, that's all I can say. I was skeptical about the battery-powered thing, but took the leap and purchased this as well as the pole trimmer. Used them this weekend and they are awesome. The rotating head on this trimmer was a godsend. The battery lasts about an hour, but only takes an hour to recharge. Your arms will need the break anyway, trust me! I highly recommend this system, and will look for other products using the same battery.
customer_reviews.author: Fitz

customer_reviews.title: You have to try it to believe it! Trully amazing product. Hope it last!
customer_reviews.text: Unbelievable ! The future is here guys! This tool has plenty of power, super light and plenty of juice. I used it yesterday for the first time, batty lasted at least 30 mins running time.. I was able to finish all my hedges ( about 90 feet long) but my hedges are left right and top... Ohhh wait.. even my wife loves it because was not able to use the husqvarna gas power trimmer that i have.. The husqvarna is going to Craigslist in a few hours! Never again i will mix gas and oil.. Hope this helps!
customer_reviews.author: Johann Sebastian Mastropiero

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight and Convenient
customer_reviews.text: I am a newbie to power tools. Now that I have to keep my home and my mother's home maintained, manual trimming is no longer an option. This trimmer is not heavy at all. I found it easy to use and worth the price. The battery charges quickly and can be used with other GreenWorks products. I found that the battery lasted for almost constant trimming for 30 to 60 minutes before it needed a charge. It definitely saved me a ton of time as well! Money well spent!
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works well for trimming
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for trimming our front and back bushes and small trees. I have 2 other Greenworks lawn products which allows me to share the same battery between the 3 of them. The battery life is excellent and I can complete a weekend's worth of all-around-the-house bush trimming with the 3 tools and 1 battery to share.
customer_reviews.author: El Kabong

customer_reviews.title: Awesome!
customer_reviews.text: This is exactly what I needed! I've been trimming my hedges with an electric hedge trimmer. They are tall and extend across my entire yard, so reaching all over with a 50 ft cord is a pain. These are perfect; even 2 inches longer than mine. My weed whacker takes the same battery, so it's perfect. The battery lasted though use of both.
customer_reviews.author: Shannon

customer_reviews.title: Drive mechanism failed after less than one hour
customer_reviews.text: I very much liked the features of this Hedge trimmer. Unfortunately the internal mechanism failed after less than one hour abuse. This was normal use add my household. Can’t recommend it
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: rusts horribly
customer_reviews.text: We didn't use this trimmer before our return window had expired, but when we did, we were disappointed: it rusts horribly! My husband is cleaning and oiling it after each use (we only used it 3 times so far), but it looks like a rusty piece of junk and cuts worse with each use.
customer_reviews.author: Z

customer_reviews.title: unbelievable service
customer_reviews.text: I was amazed by this hedgetrimmer, even bought my son one. Just because it is light and quiet, does not mean it lacks power. I am female and 76 years old and I trimmed 40 year old hedges perfectly with this trimmer. You cannot cut tree limbs( size of the hedge limbs) with it but you will be amazed at the precision steel blades it has and how well it cuts and fast.. I gave out of energy before the hedgetrimmer battery gave out but it charges quickly.
customer_reviews.author: Mary Kay Simpson

customer_reviews.title: We've gone all-cordless outdoors and love it
customer_reviews.text: We've bought cordless yard products from Black + Decker and Greenworks, and Greenworks quality seems better. Love this trimmer, we use the same battery for our Greenworks mower. This trimmer is powerful and cuts maybe better than our corded one did. It's a bit heavier than I'd expected, especially reading some of the reviews, but it's totally doable. The only feature I miss from my corded trimmer is the button to keep it powered on - can be a bit hazardous for a clutz like me, but it's nice on my corded to not have to keep the power button depressed while trimming. Overall a great buy, very happy to be cord-free!!
customer_reviews.author: Jen

customer_reviews.title: Greenworks product stopped working
customer_reviews.text: Greenworks product stopped working and tried calling customer service - after being on hold for an extremely long time I submitted an only inquiry and they never responded
customer_reviews.author: ChicagoCC

customer_reviews.title: Light easy saves so much time. Great tool! A must have
customer_reviews.text: Not a fan of buying something as simple as this BUT! Since I have the chainsaw and pruner I said why not. Its has saved me,so much time on pruning my overgrown bushes! This will go great in your Arsenal of Tools for keeping up with the Beauty of your Land! Dont hesitate any longer Stop ignoring cleaning up your overgrowth! BUY IT U WONT REGRET
customer_reviews.author: Don't get scammed

customer_reviews.title: Tuff Battery Operated Lawn Products
customer_reviews.text: I own the Greenworks Battery mower, weedeater and hedge clippers. Excellent products. I especially like that I can swap out batteries between these 3 devices. They keep a good battery charge and are light enough for my wife to operate, but still strong enough to handle tough jobs.
customer_reviews.author: Daisy

customer_reviews.title: I expected a lot!
customer_reviews.text: I expected a lot! And I got so much more, This is a first class piece of equipment. I don't have a lot to trim, but with age comes less mobility and this has made life so much easier in the late summer and early fall. I'm very glad I went with Greenworks.
customer_reviews.author: James R. Madger

customer_reviews.title: Easier To Use Than My Gas Trimmer
customer_reviews.text: I started with a Greenworks chain saw and this is my fourth piece. This makes pruning the hedges so much easier. Battery life is very good. The power is adequate, seems as good as my gas trimmer. The rotating handle is a nice feature and makes it more ergonomic to use.
customer_reviews.author: Bob

customer_reviews.title: I love this trimmer, powerful and light
customer_reviews.text: Fits my needs perfectly, replacing old gas trimmer, no gas to mix and hard starting, just charge battery and go to work. Lots of power and battery lasted long enough to trim 50' of 6' high forcithia bushes and so much more. Much better than my Homalite trimmer ever did. Very happy with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: doityourselfer

customer_reviews.title: Nice Hedge Trimmer!
customer_reviews.text: I really like the Greenworks battery powered yard tools. I have this, a mower and a chainsaw. They all use the same battery. I also like that you can buy just the tool without the battery. This trimmer is lightweight and cuts very good. The battery life is good also.
customer_reviews.author: Larry E. Flowers

customer_reviews.title: Rotating Handle Really Helps
customer_reviews.text: I got it last week and have used it twice. So far, I am very pleased. It cuts wonderfully, and the rotating handle is a definite plus. The battery life appears to be substantial. I’ve used it twice, and there’s still battery life left. It did not come with the protective scabbard, but I called the vendor and they promised to send one to me.
customer_reviews.author: J Row

customer_reviews.title: It's help me become a BUSHWHACKING BOSS!
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love this hedge trimmer. It is the third Greenworks product we have purchased and we love them all. This trimmer blade is very sharp. It has made keeping our bushes looking good easy and the battery life is great! I've shaped up our bushes, working nonstop for two solid hours and the battery was still good to go.
customer_reviews.author: Margo

customer_reviews.title: Do not purchase
customer_reviews.text: Used this for approximately one season. The blades got dull quickly and are not removable from the motor. It is not functional as it is too dull to use. Attempts to sharpen have been futile. Since there is no possibility of replacing the blades, I’m now stuck with an expensive, useless tool. Not impressed. Customer service was useless.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Decent product and a good value
customer_reviews.text: So far the trimmer has lasted the entire Texas summer. Surprisingly, the battery lasts much longer than expected. It has taken care of a fairly high maintenance yard full of bushes front and back, half acre in size with no problem.
customer_reviews.author: Dirk  Walker

customer_reviews.title: great purchase
customer_reviews.text: This is a perfect tool for all your hedge trimming needs. It charges fairly quickly and operates for an extended period on that charge. I had no issues trimming all diameter bush branches. The trimmer cut through them with ease. The 360 swivel handle is a nice option. I highly recommend this greenworks product.
customer_reviews.author: john baldassarre

customer_reviews.title: Love this trimmer, great for large ornamental grasses
customer_reviews.text: This hedge trimmer is great in the fall to cut those large coarse ornamental grasses. Goes right through them. Makes clean up soooo much easier. The battery life is awesome as well. Given it is cordless, makes clean-up move much faster !!
customer_reviews.author: Joseph Thielen

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: I have used this trimmer several times and am amazed at the power and how lightweight it is, no more dragging out the extension cords! each time I used it the battery lasted more than 3 hours! I love it! I also have the chain saw and blower/vacuum which are also fantastic!
customer_reviews.author: snowhappy

customer_reviews.title: I like it
customer_reviews.text: This is the perfect tool for trimming our shrubs. With the 2A battery, it is light and nimble. The only criticism is that I'd like to see a trigger "lock on" feature so you can keep it running and adjust your hand-hold during operation.
customer_reviews.author: T. Beaty

customer_reviews.title: A bit heavy for long use but works really well.
customer_reviews.text: I use it for the hedges, works very well and it is sturdy. I love it because its cordless and I can maneuver better without the cord. Its a bit heavy for me when I do the trimming. I'm 5'3" woman, no upper body strength. Still I'm happy with the trimmer and I would recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: SG

customer_reviews.title: Clipper good Delivery bad
customer_reviews.text: The hedge clipper is great but it was supposed to delivered by Amazon prime so why did I have to go to the Post office to pick it up? I didn't pay to be a prime member to make trips to the post office!
customer_reviews.author: donald martin

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use, long battery life.
customer_reviews.text: Since I already owned the Greenworks lawn mower and had the battery, I got the hedge trimmer (and also the pole saw at a later date). I have two small hedges and use it on those but mostly use it for trimming some large forsythia bushes and other small saplings, nothing larger than 1/4" or so. The trimmer is light and after a half-hour of use, the battery was still showing five bars.
customer_reviews.author: Tessa

customer_reviews.title: green works hedge trimmer
customer_reviews.text: This is my second trimmer, this one worked good for awhile and now just stalls and won't work, and i put another battery in and still does the same thing. i want another one that works. the last two products i have bought from green works have been crap.
customer_reviews.author: Linda

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Trimmer!!!
customer_reviews.text: What can I say but I love this thing! The battery is powerful, and lasts through me trimming all the bushes in my yard. I have a typical sized house/yard, and it does the job well. Prior to this, I had an electric trimmer and I HATED dragging around the power cord. I constantly was pulling it this way and that as I trimmed my bushes (sometimes even the cord would become unplugged). Now, I am able to bend and twist around without worry of a cord, and it cuts through very well. I decided to start switching other yard care items over to GreenWorks because of how much I liked this.
customer_reviews.author: J. Sanders

customer_reviews.title: Dependable
customer_reviews.text: Most of the time these things don’t stay charged BUT this one works forever! On one charge I can do the front and the back yard. I plan to buy more from this company, they make a good product.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Heavy hedge clipper
customer_reviews.text: I have several greenworks battery tools and have found the battery life to be satisfactory on all. My beef with this product was ,at least for me, it was heavier than expected and so harder to maneuver
customer_reviews.author: jackie

customer_reviews.title: Hedging made easy!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this along with the 24252 blower. I was tired of pulling an electrical cord and a gas powered was too much trouble and weight. I trimmed the hedges in about 20 minutes versus 45 - 50 minutes. It was just so much easier that I actually looked forward to doing the hedging. I rotated the blade and did the front side. Then turned the blade back and did the top.
customer_reviews.author: A. Parker

customer_reviews.title: Feather-light!
customer_reviews.text: This hedge-cutting device handles easily. It is light weight, cutting pencil-thin vegetation with ease. The handle rotates and locks easily. The battery performance is excellent. I am totally satisfied with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Intermission

customer_reviews.title: appears to be a well made product; good cutting ability
customer_reviews.text: This is a "well oiled machine"; works efficiently and has strong cutting ability. The battery life is not as long as I would have predicted but because I have a blower by the same brand with same battery I have two batteries and recommend same to any person who does outside work---look for products that utilize the same battery.
customer_reviews.author: John C

customer_reviews.title: Husband loves it
customer_reviews.text: Bought for xmas for my husband. Says works great. Has used to cut back some blackberry brambles. The battery works well. We have the blower, weed whacker, and the chainsaw from this company. Very pleased with all.
customer_reviews.author: laurs books

customer_reviews.title: Doing it yourself is worth it
customer_reviews.text: My wife was telling me that I could spend another $200 to have a landscaper come out and trim our shrubs or I could buy one of these and do it myself. I felt a little obligated but all in all I have to tell you they are a lot of fun to use. They work extremely well, it is lightweight, the battery power is awesome and actually I think I do a better job than the landscaper did, LOL.
customer_reviews.author: Bobby Deneke

customer_reviews.title: Mixed review - Product Appears OK, so far
customer_reviews.text: This is a mixed review. The item showed up in a horrible packaging, no support for the device and the box for torn as well as the blade guard busted. This is the worse delivery I have ever had from Amazon. On the other side, the device looks ok and when I put a battery in it, it functions correctly so far. I will have to fully test it before I can truly rate the device for quality. I have purchased several items from Greenworks and I love them, so I am planning to purchase more, but the shipping is starting to scare me.
customer_reviews.author: Johan L Partee

customer_reviews.title: Great electric tools!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased the Greeworks mower, blower/vacuum and trimmer for my mid-sized yard. They are very well built, and the interchangeable batteries means I can get the whole yard done with just two batteries on full charge. Highly recommend these products!
customer_reviews.author: SC

customer_reviews.title: Excellent trimmer, reasonable weight
customer_reviews.text: Bought in conjunction w/ pole trimmer:one battery, 2trimmers. While heavier than any corded trimmer, it was very easy to use & made very quick work of my trimming. Haven’t come close to finding end of battery charge. Trimming will no longer be such a chore & I predict my shrubs will always be trimmed. Very pleased w/ trimmer after initial use.
customer_reviews.author: Difficult to impress

customer_reviews.title: Love these hedge clippers.
customer_reviews.text: I already had the pole hedge clippers which are necessary to reach the tops of the hedges, so I was able to purchase this as the tool only without the battery or charger. This one is much lighter and much more maneuverable. The rotating handle is a great addition, and I love the 24 inch length. These shears are really sharp and do a fantastic job. The noise is not bad, so I am able to do trimming without ear protection. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Kenneth J. McNulty

customer_reviews.title: Incredible!
customer_reviews.text: This thing is super light weight, powerful similar to electric trimmers, quiet, extremely smooth operation, cuts like a razor and the battery never ran down on a very large commercial job with a lot of shrubs, 2 bars left! The battery re-charged from 2 bars to full in minutes, ready for next job now!
customer_reviews.author: Steve

customer_reviews.title: Much heavier than I thought it would be.
customer_reviews.text: The overall quality of this product is very good. The cutting blades are very sharp and able to take in 1/2" wide branches and cut them easily. The weight because of the motor and battery is heavier than corded products and should be taken into consideration.
customer_reviews.author: jewelfinder

customer_reviews.title: Great product.....................
customer_reviews.text: This is a great product. I wanted the 40 volt model for the overhead and I have not been disappointed. Not only does it cut easily, but it runs for nearly 1 1/2 hours before the battery needs to be recharged which only takes 50 minutes. The revolving grip is a real plus as well. It turns easily and stays firmly in place as well. It isn't too heavy either. I can recommend this tool without reservation.
customer_reviews.author: dan green

customer_reviews.title: For a battery/electric powered device it does great
customer_reviews.text: I was not expecting this to do well, it has surpised me and I used it a bunch this year. Make sure you spray WD40 or lubricant on the blades before every use. I didn't have any trouble but it works so well i would recommend doing that.
customer_reviews.author: Rick

customer_reviews.title: No point of reference, but worked great in trimming a giant shrub
customer_reviews.text: I haven't used other hedge trim tools, but this cut through my shrubs w/ little effort on my part. It also has this twist mechanism to make it that much easier to cut through w/o acrobatics.
customer_reviews.author: Zsoldier

customer_reviews.title: Nice product I purchased again when I wore my first one out!
customer_reviews.text: This is my second purchase- my other one was 5+ years old and worn out (I’m trimming ~20 bushes once a month in my yard in AZ). These work great and recharge quickly!
customer_reviews.author: JoAnn H.

customer_reviews.title: Top notch product
customer_reviews.text: I now have a couple Greenworks products and share a battery between them. I have the 4.0ah battery. I have never drained the battery for anything. I like gas tools, but I cannot deny how good these products are and the fact that I have never had to stop a job due to a dead battery or a weak battery.
customer_reviews.author: Eric, Michigan

customer_reviews.title: Powrful, light weight and great battery life
customer_reviews.text: This hedger is fantastic! For $55 I don't think I've bought a more valueble tool for the price. I've used it for trimming bushes, hedges, and smallish tree limbs. Anything over 1/2-3/4 inch will give it a little trouble but anything smaller it cuts just like butter. Last summer spent 6+ hours trimming the bushes in my yard and was able to do a better job with this in under and hour. Battery still had half a charge. Do yourself a favor if you've invested in Greenworks 40v batteries and get this hedger!
customer_reviews.author: Dayton W Rodman

customer_reviews.title: Works well
customer_reviews.text: This seems to work well so far. I was expecting it to just cut through really small stems and twigs, but it actually cuts through smallish branches too. Battery life seems good.
customer_reviews.author: Joshua Harazin

customer_reviews.title: lightweight powerhouse trimmer
customer_reviews.text: This lightweight trimmer is a beast. Rarely does a product actually out-perform its expectations. A 2.0 AH battery last <30 minutes of constant use. After 18 months of solid ownership the only complaint I have are the blades have dulled, but I use it often. There does not appear to be a replacement blade set available, Ive already bought another one w/o battery.
customer_reviews.author: Tony

customer_reviews.title: This thing is great
customer_reviews.text: I love this. Its light, powerful, and had me hanging out "haircuts" to all the hedges. Shares a battery with other GW products so I was also able to save some money there. I like GW products and trust them to be quality and reliable.
customer_reviews.author: JMA

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: Another Greenworks home run. I already owned a Homelite gas powered hedge trimmer but didn't really like how it cut and the weight was more than I could handle very well but this Greenworks trimmer has a longer bar, cuts way better and doesn't weigh half as much. Plus I don't have to mess with the 2-cycle gas anymore.
customer_reviews.author: Ray R.

customer_reviews.title: Great Homeowner grade series in the G-Max
customer_reviews.text: This thing is the bomb. Light weight, powerful. I have a few of the Greenworks tools. I won't call them Pro grade by any means. But I've had some of these tools for 2 years. They will hold up to standard household duty. Other brands are out there now competing with more Voltage but at nearly double the price I highly recommend these. I've had zero issues with the G-Max line. But be aware that the G-Max line is unto itself and if you buy other tools to share batteries, make sure they are all G-Max.... Enjoy!
customer_reviews.author: Midwest Hacker

customer_reviews.title: Works great.
customer_reviews.text: This trimmer works great. It cuts through hedges with surprising ease. When I unpacked it I tried it out just to test an area but it worked so well I did the entire hedge in a few minutes. It has two positions for the blades, horizontal and vertical. No shortage of power and battery life.
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: Excellent addition to the shed
customer_reviews.text: I was skeptical on the battery power. I gave out before the battery did. This is one handy little gadget and works on demand when needed. I wish the end had an open saw blade for those thicker branches. That said it works through small brush with ease.
customer_reviews.author: James T.

customer_reviews.title: 40v Trimmer
customer_reviews.text: Wasn’t sure when I bought this how it would hold up, i charged the battery for 24 hours and then trimmed the hedges that are across the front of the house. I was pleasantly surprised to find that 1. I gave out before the battery did. 2. The handle easily turned to suit my needs. 3. Because of the light weight I was able to reach farther than I expected. I have 12 acres and this will meet all my trimming needs at this time.
customer_reviews.author: Stacy Anne Hegge

customer_reviews.title: My new 40 volt Hedge Trimmer
customer_reviews.text: I received my trimmer today and used it today after my 1 hour charging. It certainly makes my trimming a lot faster and easier as it cut thru my shrubs without any problems . It’s not to heavy and the 180 degree rotation trimming is great. To early to say on battery life yet but based on my first use today, I’m very happy with it .
customer_reviews.author: Fred Bennett

customer_reviews.title: Cuts like butter and the battery lasts a long time.
customer_reviews.text: This hedge trimmer is replacing a corded B&D trimmer. Needed something light enough for my wife to handle too and since all my other hand tools are Greenworks I figured I'd give this a try. Great power and cuts through like butter. Battery lasted through all the hedges (12) and part of my neighbour's hedge. I would recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Paul Reyes

customer_reviews.title: With a bit more battery life it would be perfect
customer_reviews.text: Pros: Light, easy to use, being able to rotate the trimmer head with the push of a button is wonderful. Cons: These greenworks tools really burn through battery power like no one's business.
customer_reviews.author: S. Rahman

product_meta.title: Greenworks 24-Inch 40V Cordless Hedge Trimmer, 2.0 AH Battery Included 22262
product_meta.description: Style:2Ah Battery and ChargerGreen Works GMAX 40-Volt 2.0 Amp Hour Lithium-Ion 24-Inch Hedge Trimmer, Includes Battery and Charger, Model No.22262.
feature_bullets: G-MAX 40V Li-Ion Battery System powers multiple tools for complete yard system--includes 2AH Battery and Charger
Innovative 180 degree rotating rear handle to provide easy trimming at multiple angles with wrap around auxiliary handle for user comfort
24-Inch dual action steel blade for optimal cutting performance and reduced vibration
2/3-Inch cutting capacity gets through all your bushes and hedges with greater performance
Compatible with GreenWorks G-MAX 40V Li-Ion Battery Models 29462, 29472 and Charger 29482

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.6 out of 5 stars1,445 ratings4.6 out of 5 stars
